issue.title: [C++] Add Substrait Function Tests for Filter and Join
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-17754](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17754). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
`function_test.cc` in Substrait testing only includes `ScanAndProject` and `ScanAndAggregate`, `ScanAndFilter` and `ScanAndJoin` must be added to this test suite.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17754?focusedCommentId=17605855) by Weston Pace (westonpace):*
I'm not sure I understand what this means.  The purpose of this file was to make sure our Substrait function mapping is correct.  Why would a filter or join node be needed for this?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17754?focusedCommentId=17605905) by Vibhatha Lakmal Abeykoon (vibhatha):*
Maybe I misunderstood the comment in the parent task.
